metadata.title: CVE-2019-18277 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in HAProxy before 2.0.6. In legacy mode, messagesfeaturing a transfer-encoding header missing the "chunked" value were notbeing correctly rejected. The impact was limited but if combined with the"http-reuse always" setting, it could be used to help construct an HTTPrequest smuggling attack against a vulnerable component employing a lenientparser that would ignore the content-length header as soon as it saw atransfer-encoding one (even if not entirely valid according to thespecification).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.7
vim-haproxy - 1.8.8-1ubuntu0.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.8-1ubuntu0.7').
